skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: Use when creating or developing anything, before writing code or implementation plans - refines rough ideas into fully-formed designs through structured Socratic questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation

skill.author: ArieGoldkin

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem modifications, no external commands. Uses only standard UI interaction tools for user feedback.

content.user_title: Refine ideas into designs through structured questioning
content.value_statement: Struggling to turn rough ideas into clear designs? This skill transforms vague concepts into fully-formed designs through Socratic questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation with continuous feedback.
actual_capabilities: Guides 3-phase brainstorming process: Understanding, Exploration, Design Presentation
Uses Socratic questioning to clarify purpose, constraints, and success criteria
Presents 2-3 architectural approaches with clear trade-offs for selection
Validates design incrementally in 200-300 word sections
Applies YAGNI principle to keep designs focused and simple
Knows when to revisit earlier phases based on new information
limitations: Does not generate code or implementation plans - only designs
Requires active user participation through questions and choices
Cannot access external systems or APIs for research
Does not write documentation files automatically

use_cases.title: Clarify Feature Requirements
use_cases.description: Transform vague feature requests into clear, actionable requirements with defined constraints and success criteria.

use_cases.title: Explore Architecture Options
use_cases.description: Evaluate 2-3 architectural approaches with trade-offs before committing to a design direction.

use_cases.title: Validate Design Concepts
use_cases.description: Present designs incrementally to catch gaps early through structured feedback loops.

prompt_templates.title: Start Brainstorming
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to brainstorm a new feature. I'm thinking about [brief idea description]. Use the brainstorming skill to help refine this into a clear design.

prompt_templates.title: Explore Options
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to decide between different approaches for [component/system]. Help me explore the options using the brainstorming skill.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a rough design concept for [feature]. Walk through the design presentation phase to validate if it makes sense.

prompt_templates.title: Refine Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Our requirements for [project] are unclear. Use structured questioning to help us define purpose, constraints, and success criteria.

output_examples.input: I want to build a real-time chat feature for my web app.
output: Let me help you refine this into a clear design. First, I need to understand your needs better.
Who are the primary users of this chat feature? (A) Internal team collaboration, (B) Customer support with agents, (C) End-user to end-user messaging
What are your main constraints? Select all that apply: (A) Must work offline, (B) Maximum 100 concurrent users, (C) Must integrate with existing auth, (D) Needs message search

best_practices: Start brainstorming before writing any code to avoid rework from unclear requirements
Always present multiple approaches with trade-offs rather than recommending one solution
Validate design sections incrementally rather than presenting everything at once
anti_patterns: Skipping Phase 1 Understanding and jumping straight to implementation
Presenting only one approach without alternatives
Asking multiple questions in a single message instead of one at a time

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses standard interaction patterns available in all these platforms.

faq.question: How long does a typical brainstorming session take?
faq.answer: Sessions range from 15-45 minutes depending on complexity. Simple features take 15 minutes. Complex systems may need multiple sessions.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-technical ideas?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill is designed for any creative process that benefits from structured questioning and alternative exploration.

faq.question: Is my data safe during brainstorming sessions?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no file access or network calls. All discussion stays within your AI conversation.

faq.question: What if I need to change requirements mid-session?
faq.answer: The skill is designed to revisit earlier phases when new constraints emerge. Simply mention the new requirement.

faq.question: How is this different from general conversation?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured 3-phase process with specific techniques for effective ideation, ensuring nothing is overlooked.
